bias_adjustment.description: Refers to W5E5 data used for the bias-correction globally on a 0.5° grid.
Indicates that no bias correction was performed on the climate data (e.g. ocean data).

product.title: Input Data
product.description: The data used to drive the impact models, exactly as described in the ISIMIP simulation protocol.

product.title: Secondary Input Data
product.description: Data that have been derived from or are related to the input data, but not described in the simulation protocol (e.g. with a differnt spatial or temporal resolution).

product.title: Output Data
product.description: The climate-impacts simulation data provided by participating modelling groups, corresponding to the output variables described in the ISIMIP simulation protocol.

product.title: Secondary Output Data
product.description: Data that have been derived by processing the ISIMIP output data, but do not correspond to output variables described in the simulation protocol.

soc_scenario.description: Varying direct human influences in the historical period.
soc_scenario.description_note: Please label your model run `histsoc` **even if** it only partly accounts for varying direct human forcings while another part of the the direct human forcing is considered constant or is ignored.

datasets.comment: Input dataset documentation → [Water abstraction for domestic and industrial uses](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/38/).
Input dataset documentation → [National historical Gross Domestic Product (GDP)](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/125).
Input dataset documentation → [Water abstraction for domestic and industrial uses](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/38/).
Input dataset documentation → [National historical Gross Domestic Product (GDP)](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/126).

soc_scenario.description: Fixed year-2015 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
soc_scenario.description_note: Please label your simulations `2015soc` if they do not at all account for historical changes in direct human forcing, but they do represent constant year-2015 levels of direct human forcing for at least some direct human forcings.

forest_stand.title: Hyytiälä
forest_stand.comment: Note that an experimental plot of pine contains a lot of data while footprint of flux tower is larger. Please note that the deciduous admixtures only appear in the data at a later stage and hence do not need to be simulated. Only simulate pine and spruce (no hard-woods) and regenerate as pure pine stand

forest_stand.title: Peitz
forest_stand.comment: Managed using a weak thinning from below.

forest_stand.title: Kranzberg Roof Project
forest_stand.comment: Unmanaged/ thinning from below in past 20 years for all species.

simulation_round.title: ISIMIP3a
simulation_round.description: Historical model evaluation and attribution runs

simulation_round.title: ISIMIP3b
simulation_round.description: GCM-based simulations assuming fixed 2015 direct human influences for the future

geo_dataset.comment: Input dataset documentation → [Land-sea mask](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/41/). Same as **landseamask** but without Antarctica.

Input dataset documentation → [Land-sea mask](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/41/). This is the generic land-sea mask from ISIMIP2b that is to be used for global water simulations in ISIMIP3. It marks more grid cells as land than **landseamask**. Over those additional land cells, the climate data that are based on W5E5 (GSWP3-W5E5 as well as climate data bias-adjusted using W5E5) are not guaranteed to represent climate conditions over land. Instead they may represent climate conditions over sea or a mix of conditions over land and sea.
Country masks from the ISIpedia project. More formats are available at <https://github.com/ISI-MIP/isipedia-countries>.
Fractional country masks from the ISIpedia project. More formats are available at <https://github.com/ISI-MIP/isipedia-countries>.

category.title: Climate related forcing
category.description: Forcing data describing physical or chemical systems, in particular the climate, the oceans, and the cryosphere.

category.title: Static geographic information
category.description: Geographic or other time-independent information, such as land-sea masks, or river routing networks.

category.title: Direct human forcing
category.description: Independent additional forcing data, which influence climate impacts, such as land-use, population or economic changes.

harmonization.title: Default
harmonization.description: Model should use their individual “best representation” of the historical period with regard to sowing dates, harvesting dates, fertilizer application rates and crop varieties.

harmonization.title: Fully harmonized
harmonization.description: Simulations based on prescribed “present day” fertilization rates (available for download) and fixed planting and harvesting dates (also available for download). Modelers should have planting as closely as possible to these dates, but it may be admissible to use these dates as indicators for planting windows (depending on model specifics).

harmonization.title: Harmonized seasons with no N constraints
harmonization.description: For models with an explicit description of the nitrogen cycle: harmnon simulations should be run with nitrogen stress turned off completely or (if that’s not possible) with very high N application rates to make model results comparable between those GGCMs that have explicit N dynamics and those that do not. For models without the nitrogen cycle: harmnon and fullharm simulations are the same and do not need to be duplicated. Please contact the sector coordination to push on with this side branch.

sens_scenario.description: For all experiments other than the sensitivity experiments.
CO₂ concentration fixed at 1901 levels as a deviation from the `obsclim` climate + CO₂ forcing.

datasets.dataset: Local atmospheric climate forcing for lake locations
datasets.comment: Extractions of grid cell data from global atmospheric climate forcing. See list of lakes sites [here](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/isimip3-local-lake-sites/).

datasets.dataset: Regional oceanic climate forcing for regional marine ecosystems and fisheries sector
datasets.comment: Extractions of grid cell data from global atmospheric climate forcing.

soc_dataset.comment: Because the data from KSU is yet unpublished, modeling teams using it are asked to offer co-authorship to the team at KSU on any resulting publications. Please contact <info@isimip.org> in case of questions.

soc_dataset.title: Water abstraction for domestic and industrial purposes
soc_dataset.comment: Input dataset documentation → [Water abstraction for domestic and industrial uses](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/38/).

soc_dataset.title: Not forest-related land transformation
soc_dataset.comment: The data set consists of 115 land transformation categories, one for each transition from one type of land use to another. Considered land use types: **secdf** (potentially forested secondary land), **secdn** (potentially non-forested secondary land), **urban** (urban land), **c3ann** (C3 annual crops), **c4ann** (C4 annual crops), **c3per** (C3 perennial crops), **c4per** (C4 perennial crops), **c3nfx** (C3 nitrogen-fixing crops), **pastr** (managed asture), **range** (rangeland). Input dataset documentation → [Gridded historical land transformation](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/142/).

variables.long_name: One variable for each transition from one type of land use to another.
total number of people per country
